item.title: Shoq
item.description: A gen-Z told me today that his generation has largely accepted that they live in a plutocracy, everything is corrupt, and the Musks, Zuckerbergs, and Trumps are just a fact of existence. They accept it as SOP. It's pretty dark, and exactly what GOP wants them to feel: totally hopeless and disinterested in voting. If they let that despair keep them from voting in 2024, they will learn the hard way just how much more there was and is to lose. We need to change their minds. For their sakes.

item.title: Tim Hanson
item.description: https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.11644 Textbooks are all you needDemonstrates that by training on a high-quality yet small dataset (7B tokens, 7 epochs), a small network (1.3B parameters) can beat almost all models in Python coding (except for GPT-4, which has 1.7T parameters.)The model was trained for 4 days on 8 GPUs, orders of magnitude less than lower-performing models. (Environmentalists, rejoice!)
